required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 08, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Presenting Nutrition Characteristics, Comorbidities and Outcomes of COVID-19 in African Humanitarian Settings
clinical_study.official_title: Presenting Nutrition Characteristics, Comorbidities and Outcomes of COVID-19 in African Humanitarian Settings: a Prospective Cohort Study in South Sudan and DRC

lead_sponsor.agency: Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health

collaborator.agency: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

clinical_study.source: Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health

brief_summary.textblock: This study will characterize risk factors for poor COVID-19 outcomes (hospitalization, death) and clinical progression of hospitalized COVID-19 patients in South Sudan and Eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo.

detailed_description.textblock: A prospective cohort design will be used to follow suspected, probable, and confirmed COVID-19 cases presenting for care at International Medical Corp [supported] health facilities in Juba, South Sudan and the Kivus in Eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC). This research seeks to assess risk factors for poor outcomes and characterize clinical disease progression of COVID-19 cases in resource-poor humanitarian contexts in Africa. Specifically, this study aims to characterize risk factors for poor COVID-19 outcomes, including both co-morbidities with evidence from high income settings, as well as prevalent conditions in humanitarian settings (e.g., acute malnutrition, malaria, HIV) for which data is not yet available. This research also aims to determine how the progression of confirmed COVID-19 cases in resource-poor African settings may differ from other settings where data are available.

primary_outcome.time_frame: patients will be followed until asymptomatic or deceased (an average of approximately 1 month)
primary_outcome.description: Hospitalization due to COVID-19 (proportion of participants hospitalized and risk factors for hospitalization)

primary_outcome.time_frame: patients will be followed until asymptomatic or deceased (an average of approximately 1 month)
primary_outcome.description: Death due to COVID-19 (proportion of participants deceased and risk factors for death)

arm_group.description: Suspected and confirmed COVID-19 cases (age 5 years and above) identified at health facilities or via mobile teams in Juba, South Sudan and in Eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo.

study_pop.textblock: Adults and children >=5 years of age residing in catchment areas of participating health facilities and mobile contact tracing teams in Juba, South Sudan and in Eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Suspected, probable, and confirmed COVID-19 cases presenting for care at participating health facilities (either by walk-in, referral or transfer) or identified by mobile contact tracing teams.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Individuals unable or unwilling to give informed consent (e.g., due to mental impairment)

overall_official.affiliation: Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health

patient_data.ipd_description: A limited de-identified data set will be posted on humanitarian data exchange.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Upon completion of analysis and publication of the results, the data will be made publicly available.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: None - data will be accessible via Humanitarian Data Exchange
